problem_text:
5.22. L^p-dissipativity of the Lamé operator
Consider the Dirichlet problem with zero boundary condition for the Lamé operator L defined in the previous section.
We say that L is L^p-dissipative if for all u ∈ [C^∞_0(Ω)]^n
∫_Ω Lu · |u|^{p−2} u dx ≤ 0,
where 1 < p < ∞.
In [9, Chapter 3], we prove that for n = 2 the operator L is L^p-dissipative if and only if
( (1/2 − 1/p)^2 ) ≤ 2(ν − 1)(2ν − 1) / (3 − 4ν)^2.
(5.18)
For n = 3 this inequality is necessary for the L^p-dissipativity of L and there are some sufficient conditions. However, the following problem is unsolved.
Problem. Prove or disprove that (5.18) is sufficient for the L^p-dissipativity of L in the three-dimensional case.
